channel.title: Firemakeing help please!
channel.description: :confused: [size=10pt][b]When I light a fire I stay on the same spot. How do I change that so it moves aside automatically so I can light the next fire? By the way I have a Delta source (317). Thanks! -Jim[/b][/size]

item.title: Firemakeing help please!
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

Look closely to my code

} } else if ((itemUsed == 1513) && (useWith == 590)) { if (playerLevel[11] >= 75) { deleteItem(1513, getItemSlot(1513), 1); walkTo(-1, 0); makeGlobalObject(absX,absY, 2732, 0, 10); addSkillXP(850, 11); sM("You attempt to light the logs."); sM("The fire catches and the logs begin to burn."); resetWC(); } else { sM("You need a firemaking level of 75 to burn magic logs."); } }

You should see this line

walkTo(-1, 0);

Which determens which way you will move after you light the fire.

Read full topic

item.title: Firemakeing help please!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“agfy25, post:1, topic:365144”] [size=10pt]When I light a fire I stay on the same spot. How do I change that so it moves aside automatically so I can light the next fire? By the way I have a Delta source (317).
Thanks!
-Jim[/size][/quote]
not so sure, but check if after lighting a log, it makes your char go one absX (or Y) to the left! thats just my random guess after thinking for a good 30 seconds
